name: Counterparty name
description: Specifies the name of the counterparty (often, the customer's company name). Ensure this is the customer's legal entity name, and not the name of the provider or the provider's parent company.

name: Counterparty signer name
description: Specifies the name of the signer for the counterparty. Ensure this is the customer's employee name, and not the name of the provider or the provider's employee.

name: Counterparty signer title
description: Specifies the title of the signer for the counterparty. Ensure this is the customer's employee title, and not the title of the provider or the provider's employee.

name: Counterparty signer email
description: Specifies the email of the signer for the counterparty. Ensure this is the customer's employee email, and not the email of the provider or the provider's employee.

name: Signed
description: Specifies if the counterparty has signed the agreement. This is often provided as a checkbox or a signature block at the end of the document, or as a separate page from a verification authority (e.g., DocuSign, e-SignLive, etc.).

name: Effective date
description: Specifies the date on which the agreement becomes effective.

name: Signing date
description: Specifies the date on which the agreement was signed by the counterparty. This is often provided as a date in the signature block or as a separate page from a verification authority (e.g., DocuSign, e-SignLive, etc.).

name: Termination date
description: Specifies the date on which the agreement will terminate, or date on which the agreement ends.

name: Term
description: Specifies the duration of the agreement
outputFormat: X years | X months | X days

name: Renewable
description: Specifies if the agreement is renewable beyond the initial term stated.

name: Termination for convenience
description: Outlines the conditions under which either party can end the agreement before the term expires. This includes termination for cause (like breach of contract) and termination for convenience (without cause, often requiring notice).

name: Consent required for termination
description: If either party can end the agreement before the term expires for any reason (not including cause), this clause states if consent is required from the other party.

name: Termination for cause
description: Outlines the conditions under which either party can end the agreement before the term expires. This includes termination for cause (like breach of contract) and termination for cause

name: Governing law
description: Specifies the governing law of the agreement.

name: Opt-out period
description: Specifies the period of time after the contract is signed during which the counterparty can opt out of the agreement.
